citations.narrative:
Approximately 25% of the guinea pig enclosures had portions of the pens that were mats of solid fecal material with no
clean bedding available. The guinea pig pens contained a large amount of soiled, wet bedding covering 50-100% of the
enclosure. In one pen, the entire pen was coated in a thick, brown, wet sludge at least 1 inch deep in the enclosure. This
enclosure contained approximately 9 guinea pigs and the animals' fur and legs was coated in wet, brown material. The
licensee stated the enclosures were last cleaned 5 days ago but they ran out of bedding.
The accumulation of feces and unclean enclosures can cause unpleasant odors, lead to contamination of the enclosure,
and attract pests and vermin that carry diseases that result in risks to the health of the animals.
Enclosures must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to prevent a build-up of debris and fecal material and
sanitized at a minimum of once every two weeks.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
TONYA HADJIS n

narrative:
3.31(a)(1)  Direct Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
Approximately 25% of the guinea pig enclosures had portions of the pens that were mats of solid fecal material with no 
clean bedding available. The guinea pig pens contained a large amount of soiled, wet bedding covering 50-100% of the 
enclosure. In one pen, the entire pen was coated in a thick, brown, wet sludge at least 1 inch deep in the enclosure. This 
enclosure contained approximately 9 guinea pigs and the animals' fur and legs was coated in wet, brown material. The 
licensee stated the enclosures were last cleaned 5 days ago but they ran out of bedding. 
The accumulation of feces and unclean enclosures can cause unpleasant odors, lead to contamination of the enclosure, 
and attract pests and vermin that carry diseases that result in risks to the health of the animals. 
Enclosures must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to prevent a build-up of debris and fecal material and 
sanitized at a minimum of once every two weeks. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
TONYA HADJIS n
